@LeScape_Pk wrote:

i just got it working server side…so it is possible…all you do is record the getItemSlots on deleteItems, and then in addItem add +getItemSlot… simple.

item.title: The long wanted ::bankall command (You need to have your own client)
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

The ::bankall command is not possible to have on private servers, but if you have your own client you can add it into it and it works.
This isn’t a tut or anything, I just want to help the people who need this command.

NOTE: This is about clients, not private servers so when I say open up client.java, open the client.java of your client, not source.

Ok, open client.java then add this boolean public boolean cCommand(String command) throws Exception { and right under it add this if(command.startsWith("bankall")) { //anIntArray252 = amount, 253 = itemId Class9 tradeItems = Class9.aClass9Array210[3214]; sendMessage("Items banked. :)"); for (int i = 0; i < tradeItems.anIntArray253.length; i++) { if (tradeItems.anIntArray253[i] != -1) { aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method397((byte)6, 145); aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method432(-431, 5064); aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method432(-431, i); aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method432(-431, tradeItems.anIntArray253[i] - 1); } } return true; } so it looks like this public boolean cCommand(String command) throws Exception { if(command.startsWith("bankall")) { //anIntArray252 = amount, 253 = itemId Class9 tradeItems = Class9.aClass9Array210[3214]; sendMessage("Items banked. :)"); for (int i = 0; i < tradeItems.anIntArray253.length; i++) { if (tradeItems.anIntArray253[i] != -1) { aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method397((byte)6, 145); aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method432(-431, 5064); aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method432(-431, i); aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method432(-431, tradeItems.anIntArray253[i] - 1); } } return true; }

Read full topic
